div.ab:
لم نرا ترا يرا يأبا جعفر حفص جعلت فداك كــما قد كتبت إليك قبل كتابي هذا
لأكتب سألتك في كتابي أن تكتب إلي عن بخبرك كون ø حالك وحالك وحوائجك فإن شرّفتني
أن تــنظر أكرمك اللّه أن تكتب إلي عن بخبرك كون وخبر أم جعفر حفص أبقاها اللّه والصّبيان أعزّهم اللّه وحفظهم
بأبقا عافية يأبا جعفر حفص لو رأيت ما النّاس فيه عندنا اليوم من التّخليط والسّخرة يوحد
النّواتيّة وغير النّواتيّة وكلّمن ڤدروا علپه احدوه پدحلوأ كل پوم يحماعه من كل موصع اسل
الــلّه الفرج من عند رحمته والأمير أيّده اللّه قد خرج إلى المحلّة ودمياط من يوم الخميس
وهو أوّل يوم من مسرى وأخرج معه جماعة من الخيل الجند وذلك أنّه ورد عليه كتاب
من أمير المومپپن أعزّه اللّه يشدّد عليه أن يريّح يريح عندي رسم كتاب لا أقدر أن أكتب به إليك
وإذا وردت عليه الخريطة لعلّه الأمير أبقاه اللّه خرج
حرك حرل أبي العبّاس أخي أبقاه اللّه يكتــب

*** **** lam narā tarā yarā yā ʾabā ǧaʿfara ḥafṣ:in ǧuʿiltu fidāʾa ka kamā qad katabtu ʾilay ka qabla kitāb ī hāḏā ************
*** li ʾaktuba saʾaltu ka fī kitāb ī ʾan taktuba ʾilay ya ʿan bi ø ḫabari ø ka kawni ø ø wa ḥāli ka wa ḥawāʾiǧi ka fa ʾin šarrafta nī **************
ʾan tanẓura ʾakrama ka ăl lāhu ʾan taktuba ʾilay ya ʿan bi ø ḫabari ø ka kawni wa ø ḫabari ʾummi ǧaʿfara ḥafṣ:in ʾabqā hā ăl lāhu wa ăṣ ṣibyāni ʾaʿazza humu ăl lāhu wa ḥafiẓa hum
bi ʾabqā ʿāfiyaẗ:in yā ʾabā ǧaʿfara ḥafṣ:in law raʾayta mā ăn nāsu fī hi ʿinda nā ăl yawma mina ăt taḫlīṭi wa ăs suḫraẗi yuʾḫaḏu
ăn nawātiyyaẗu wa ġayru ăn nawātiyyaẗi wa kullu man man qadarū ʿalay hi ʾaḫaḏū hu yadḫulū kulla yawm:in bi ǧamāʿaẗ:in min kulli mawḍiʿ:in ʾasalu
ăl lāha ăl faraǧa min ʿindi raḥmati hi wa ăl ʾamīru ʾayyada hu ăl lāhu qad ḫaraǧa ʾilà ăl maḥallaẗi wa dimyāṭa min yawmi ăl ḫamīsi
wa huwa ʾawwalu yawm:in min misrà wa ʾaḫraǧa maʿa hu ǧamāʿaẗ:an mina ăl ḫayli ǧundi wa ḏālika ʾanna hu warada ʿalay hi kitāb:un
min ʾamīri ăl muʾminīna ʾaʿazza hu ăl lāhu yušaddidu ʿalay hi ʾan yurayyiḥa yurīḥa ʿind ī rasmu kitāb:in lā ʾaqdiru ʾan ʾaktuba bi hi ʾilay ka
wa ʾiḏā waradat ʿalay hi ăl ḫarīṭaẗu laʿalla hu ăl ʾamīru ʾabqā hu ăl lāhu ḫaraǧa *** ********************
ḥrk ḥrl ʾabī ăl ʿabbāsi ʾaḫ ī ʾabqā hu ăl lāhu yaktubu ********

[...] .... we did not think (or: you did not think), o Abū Jaʿfar, - may I be made your ransom - as I wrote you before this letter of mine (?) ± 12 [...].... we (or he, or she, or you) did not think, o Abū Ḥafṣ, may I be made your ransom - I wrote you before this letter of mine ± 12
[...] that I write. I asked you in my letter to write me about your health and your needs; and if you would honor me ± 14 [...] that I write. I asked you in my letter to write me about your state, your situation and your needs, and if you would honor me ± 14
[to s]ee - may God give you honor - to write me about the state and situation of Umm Ḥafṣ - may God grant her a long life - and of the children - may God strengthen [and preserve them] [to s]ee - may God give you honor - to write me about the state of Umm Jaʿfar - may God grant her a long life - and the children - may God strengthen [and preserve them]
[in the most] lasting welfare. O Abū Ḥafṣ, if you only could see the confusion and pressure in which people are now here! [in the most] lasting welfare. O Abū Jaʿfar, if only you could see the confusion and pressure in which people are now here! O Abû Ḥafṣ, if only you could see the confusion and pressure in which people are here now!
Both sailors and those who are not sailors are taken away. They took everybody whom they could get. Every day they bring in a troop from each place; I ask Both the sailors and those who are no sailors are taken away. They took everybody whom they could reach. Every day they come in with troops from all places. I ask
G[od] for relief by His mercy! The Emir - may God assist him - left for al-Maḥalla and Damietta on Thursday, God for relief by His mercy! The Governor - may God strengthen him - already left for al-Maḥalla and Damietta on Thursday,
the first day of Misrâ, and took out with him a troop of the army, and this as he received a letter which is the first of Mesori, and took out with him a troop of cavalry. This happened because he received a letter which is the first of Mesorī, and took out with him troops from the army. This happened because he received a letter
from the Commander of the Faithful - may God help him - pressing him hard to move; I habe a copy of the letter about which I cannot write you, from the Commander of the Faithful - may God strengthen him - urging him to give rest. I have a copy of a letter about which I cannot write you;
and since the message arrived to him, perhaps the Emir - may God give him a long life - left ... and when he received the dispatch, perhaps the Governor - may God prolong his life - left.
.... my brother Abuʾl-ʿAbbās - may <God> give him a long life -; he will wri[te] ....
